Name: The Game of Red Riding Hood
Description: A roll-and-move children's game based on the Grimm's fairy tale Little Red Riding Hood. Comes with a cast iron Little Red Riding Hood. Came out around 1895.

Name: Re-Discover Historical Washington, PA
Description: A real-estate game unique to the Washington, Pennsylvania area. Similar to Monopoly. Produced by the local Rotary club as a fund raiser.

Name: Monopoly: Harley-Davidson Legendary Bikes
Description:
From the Manufacturer:

The ultimate board game and a must have collectible for the Harley-Davidson enthusiast, this game incorporates buying, selling and trading the all-time greatest motorcycles in a quest to own the most legendary bikes in Harley-Davidson history.

Name: Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory, The Game
Description:
From the box 
"GREETINGS CHOCOLATE LOVERS.

You are the lucky winner of a Wonka Golden ticket.  Come with me on a magical journey through the factory.  In you wildest dreams you cannot imagine the surprises I have in store.

You have waited a long time, but, at last the day has arrived, so lets not wait any longer.  Follow me on your adventure which you will not forget for the rest of your lives.

Who knows you may be the lucky person to reach the end of our journey and win all the sweets and chocolate that you can eat.

Contains
1 Dice
1 Game board
6 Golden tickets playing pieces
6 plastic stands"

Name: Jack and the Beanstalk Adventure Game
Description: A spin and move game for 2 to 4 children. Each child plays as Jack, spinning and moving around the beanstalk board, collecting treasure cards. Includes 12 treasure cards, four jacks in different colors, one Giant piece, and spinner.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Jack and the Beanstalk

Name: Monopoly: San Francisco Giants
Description: For 2 - 6 players Ages 8 and up. Pewter miniatures in this edition are : pitcher, hot dog, Giants baseball cap, batter, ball in glove, catcher's mask.

Name: Monopoly: Mountaineering
Description: This Monopoly edition takes you on a mountaineering adventure.  Tents and basecamps take the place of houses and hotels, and the pewter tokens are climber, yak, canteen, hiking boot, rope, and tent.

Name: Overtime
Description:
Overtime is a game supplement to The Hunt by Maverick Games Co.  The book clarifies rules, offers more arms, armor, and optional rules to enhance the base game.

Let's not forget the Kings of the Maze:  The Foxes.  The Overtime supplement adds seven new Foxes to cause headaches and mayhem in the Maze they are placed into.

See also Overtime

Expands:

    The Hunt

Name: Kolme pientä porsasta (Tre små grisar)
Description:
The theme of the game is the story of Three Little Pigs and the Big Bad Wolf; the game consists of four player tokens, the board and a die. The players draw lots over who is the Wolf.
The players roll the die and move their tokens according to the roll. The player who reaches the goal first is the winner. However, the Wolf must capture all three Pigs in order to win. In case he is ahead of all three Pigs, the Wolf, and he alone, may move backwards.
If the Wolf arrives at a circle where a Pig is resting, he has captured the Pig and that player must remain there. If another Pig arrives at this circle, the captured Pig is released. He may also gain his own freedom by rolling a six.
If a Pig arrives at a circle where the Wolf is resting, the latter must remain there for two turns.
In addition to these basic rules, there are several special event circles that have their own rules for the Pigs and the Wolf.

Name: Bella Sara
Description:
Bella Sara is an imaginative, joyful world of horses, where every girl is special and uniquely beautiful! Horse cards can be collected, traded with friends and used to play fun card games. Each horse has a positive message for you to discover. Every card also has an activation code, which you can enter on bellasara.com to put your horses online in your very own stable.

Once your horse is online, it will be your friend forever! You can care for your horse by feeding it, training it, brushing it and building up its energy. What is Bella Sara’s World? It’s a magical place that you can explore with your favorite horses. There are castles and forests, beaches and racetracks – everything a horse and a girl could wish for.

Name: Plimil
Description:
Game of strategy and memory, and suspense for two players, with unusual material.

The players create their block-pawns and their starting zone. They receive 12 block-pawns, 18 pawns of their color, 6 pawns of the opponent's color, and 12 neutral pawns. Players secretly insert combinations of 3 pawns in each block-pawn: 1 pawn of their visible color in the window; and 2 pawns of their choice. At the same time as the placement of the block-pawns on the board, the players build their starting zone by positioning the stems. The game begins with 12 blue block-pawns against 12 red block-pawns. The unfolding game will reveal neutral block-pawns, playable by the 2 players.

With each color a direction with displacement and catch is associated. The catch of an opponent's block-pawn consists in turning over it and replanting it on another stem. According to the internal combination of the block-pawn and the height of the stem, this action involves a modification of color, due to the translation of the pawns. No block-pawn is eliminated materially from the plate, it is transformed. As soon as a neutral block-pawn is present on the play, the players can turn the board a quarter of a turn, to counter their adversary, or to prepare their next blow: another vision of the play arises. The part is finished as soon as a color (Blue, Reed, Neutral) is represented more only by 7 block-pawns on the plate. The players count their respective block-pawns (Blue, Red). That which has some more gained: it is the rule of the 7.

Home Page: http://www.plimil.fr/

Name: Scrapyard Wars
Description:
From Boardgame News:

If the Scrapyard Wars title sounds familiar, that might be because it combines the names of Scrapheap Challenge—a British television show in which teams compete to build working machines out of scrap parts—and Junkyard Wars, the short-running U.S. program with the same set-up.

Now, instead of watching others transform junk into functioning junk, you get to assemble a few machines of your own—robots, to be precise, and preferably robots that will withstand some punishment. “Scrapyard Wars is a unique take on a combat arena style game in which players seek to build the best robots they can and then keep them alive long enough to get the most value out of their creation,” says designer Steve Sisk.

On a turn, a player can add a piece of scrap to his hand (either drawing randomly or exchanging a part in his hand for a face-up one), build a robot, add parts to a robot already in play (to earn more VPs), or retire a robot (to protect the VPs already earned by that bot). “Robots are worth VPs depending on the quality and mix of parts used to build them,” says Sisk. Robots hold up to four VP tiles worth 1-3 VPs each. “The longer the robots are around, the more VP they’ll earn—but the VPs for a robot may be lost if the robot is defeated or destroyed by another robot.”

During set-up, seven parts tiles are included for each player, and the game ends when a players takes the final tile. Adds Sisk, “With more players, there’s more risk of a more powerful robot being targeted by everyone else, so players must be careful when building. A very powerful robot will earn the most VPs, but will be more at risk of being destroyed. Players become more interested in trying to slip a less powerful robot under the radar of other players and build VPs slowly.”

Name: Plan-It
Description: The objective of the game is to form an unbroken line adjoining two opposite sides of the board. You have link (move one space)and key link (move any number of spaces) pieces. pieces line up black left right, white top bottom and key links in the middle.

Name: Mighty Empires: Warhammer Expansion
Description:
Mighty Empires, the first Warhammer Expansion, enables you to fight sweeping campaigns throughout the Warhammer World. The flexible tile-based map system ensures that no two campaigns need be the same. The plastic map tiles are extremely versatile and with the exception of the mountain tiles all the tiles are double-sided. This gives a staggering 90 tile options per kit. also included is a full rulebook on how to run and play Mighty Empires campaigns.

White Dwarf issue #330 (July 2007) is packed with 2 free tiles.

Name: Wampanoag
Description:
From the Publisher:

As the Pilgrims arrive in Massachusetts, the Wampanog face tough choices:  There is a time to trade, and there is a time to Stand and Fight.  In Wampanog, manage the actions of your people in war and peace.

Name: Celebrity Piggy
Description:
Here's a fast-moving fun game for people of all ages. It's a great party game because any number of people can play. Or you can challenge just one person to a duel with the dice. In the place of 1's on the dice are smiling pigs.

Everybody antes one chip into the pot. You roll the dice as many times as you want to earn 100 points, but rolling a piggy ends your turn and rolling two piggies takes away all the points accumulated up to that point in the game (at which point everyone else goes "oink oink" to show how greedy you were). The player then has to ante another chip into the pot.

Whoever gets to 100 points gets all the chips in the pot and is the winner for that round.

(Note that despite the involvement of Peter Marshall and the use of "Celebrity" in the title, Celebrity Piggy was never actually a game show.)

Name: Game Night at Nate's
Description:
(This game was a one-of-a-kind gift for Nate (Cavedog_pdx on BGG) designed and assembled by his regular gaming group. He had no idea what 14 of his friends were up to!)

From the English rules:

It’s Game Night at Nate’s! As the regulars trickle in, the haggling begins. What to play?

In this highly realistic simulation, you earn points by having fun. Play lots of games with lots of people.  Earn bonus points when you play your favorite games. Better yet, dive for a seat in a game with everyone’s favorite host, Nate. The player who earns the most points by the end of the evening wins.

Name: Spice Islands
Description: "A game for 2-5 players of investment, transport and company ownership set in the time when fortunes turned on the arrival of a ship from the Spice Islands. That is, if it got past the pirates. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins."

Name: Open Whist
Description:
"Before bridge there was whist, a much simpler card game to learn but nonetheless a challenging game of strategy for four players.  Now there's Open Whist, a modern variation that two, three, or four players can enjoy."

Open Whist was originally designed so that two or three players could enjoy whist. In the two-player variant the players have two hands each. They are playing both the role of themselves and their "partner" in standard Whist. The main difference is that all of the cards are played face-up in a pattern that only allows certain cards to be played at any given point in time.

Name: Cubed
Description:
From the box:

"Choose your color, place your cubes (dice). "Rock", "paper", and "scissor" cubes appear, disappear, move, rotate and capture until only one remains.

Many ways to play - the basic game for kids of all ages or the advanced game for a greater "cubic" challenge!"

The game uses custom dice and the board and box are laser-cut and laser-etched wood.

Name: Master Nexus
Description:
Master Nexus is a connection of words, be it lexicon, geography, history, or famous people. Each player spells out words by placing pegs in holes under the corresponding letters. Each player in turn tries to form a word of one or more letters starting with the last letter used by the previous player. The first player scoring 150 points wins the game. No player should take more than one minute to form a word.

The game consists of a peg-board with 324 lettered holes in seemingly random order, and 324 pegs. The words are not connected as in Scrabble; the players simply fill up available letters on the board, and they cannot create words with, say, T if all Ts have been used. (Not counting the final letter of the last player's word.)

Name: Monopoly: Utah
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly with Utah themed spaces and cards.

Name: The Peter Rabbit Radish Board Game
Description:
The Peter Rabbit Radish Board Game

It’s a race around the vegetable garden collecting radishes, carrots, green beans and lettuce, but watch out for grumpy Mr McGregor….if he catches you then you’ll be going to bed with a very empty tummy indeed!

Name: Jacob's Ladder
Description: This is a children's religious (Christian) trivia game.  The game includes a cassette tape which asks questions.  Children then compete to answer correctly, with correct answers being rewarded with movement up their "ladder."

Name: Magicians
Description:
Card game for 2-4+. Players are Rival Stage Magicians at the turn of the Century trying to one-up each other. Whomever accumulates 100 Prestige Points first wins. The Player's Alter Egos build up their acts with increasingly difficult Tricks and supplement them with Lovely Assistants, helpers, props, and other aids. Players can also Sabotage each other by cards that discard or steal their resources. The rules are free and can be found at: 
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Magicians.html

Name: Business Game Delft
Description:
This is a board game published in 1996 to celebrate Delft's 750 years as a cultural city. It appears to be published/supported by a host of Dutch business, particularly those based in Delft. One of the businesses is Jumbo games. Several forewords from the various companies involved in the game are found in the rules book.

The board is a 12 X 12 square grid superimposed on a map of Delft. The object of the game is to place tiles on the board, with the coordinates determined by rolling two dice (with opportunities for two re-rolls). When a square of four tiles is on the board, it is considered completed and is turned over to show an 'object worth seeing'. Rolling doubles allows one to roll a special die, which could result in an extra turn, being allowed to place two tiles anywhere on the board, or missing the next turn.

The game ends when someone has completed five objects worth seeing. Scoring points is based on where the tiles in completed objects lie. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Conquest of Pangea: Atlantis
Description:
An add-on to the Origins Award-Winning game, Conquest of Pangea, Atlantis introduces a new continent which attaches to the first subcontinent to break off from Pangea, as well as a new terrain type, Hot Springs, and a new Power card.  Additionally, the ruleset outlines revisions and clarifications to the basic rule set.

Expands:

    Conquest of Pangea

Name: Mexican Hold'em Poker
Description:
52 new cards for your Texas Hold'em poker games!
Before dealing a new hand, you discover a card that will change the rules for the next hand.
Only funny cards like "Shared Secrets", instead of dealing two cards to each player, you deal one card between each player and you play with the cards on your left and on your right, then knowing one card of each of your left and right opponent.
Another one is "Weedkiller" which will remove all clibs cards which will be replaced by another one when you are dealt a club (same for the board).

This is a good extension to introduce new poker player you would otherwise beat too easily!

Expands:

    Poker

Name: Millennium 3D Chess
Description:
Over the years, there have been numerous attempts to develop rules for three dimensional (3D) chess using  three standard 8 by 8 chess boards (3x8x8), however, many of these games suffered from major problems that distracted the players from the essential characteristics of traditional chess. Some of these 3D chess variations created new chess pieces while other 3D rules imposed mandatory or unusual moves. In addition, many of these "rules" were generally incomplete causing inconsistent interpretations. None of these game variations offered a truly playable chess game.

Because of the lack of playable rules, the Millennium 3D Chess rules were written with the objective of extending the traditional chess game into a multilevel environment without distorting the basic game. To this end, Millennium 3D Chess has not "created" new chess rules, but instead extended the traditional rules to allow for multi-board play. Other than the concept of moving between chess boards (levels), all traditional two (2D) chess rules apply.

Name: El Cid
Description:
From the publisher:
Warfare in the Spanish Reconquista: 900-1250 AD

Rodrigo Diaz, better known as El Cid, is one of the most famous warriors of the Middle Ages. His deeds are legendary and his adventures in a world of Moors and Christians, castillos and caballeros, provide ideal territory for games of Warhammer Ancient Battles.

This source book contains an historical overview and detailed chronologies outlining the important events and battles of the time.

This book will give you 8 detailed lists featuring:


     Armies of Christian Spain - The early Christian Kingdoms, the Age of El Cid and the Reconquista. 
     Armies of Al-Andalus - The Caliphate of Cordoba, the Taifa Kings and the Later Taifas. 
     Armies of the African Invaders - The Almoravids and the Almohads. 
     Aliados y Mercenarios - Allies and Mercenaries available for hire to complement your armies. 


The age in which El Cid lived is one of the most colourful in military history and the armies are spectacular and varied and this is portrayed in a 16-page color section.

Accompanying each of the army lists are detailed notes on wargaming tactics, and collecting and painting the various armies that fought in Medieval Spain.

The book also contains two new scenarios for games of Warhammer Ancient Battles, as well as a campaign system allowing you to hire El Cid himself!

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles

Name: Alexander the Great
Description:
From the publisher:
Alexander the Great is one of the most famous names in history, and he led his armies to the ends of the earth and carved out an empire. Upon his death, the empire he conquered split apart within a few years.

This source book contains a detailed historical overview of the period outlining the important events and battles of Alexander’s Age up until his death.

Featured within this book are detailed army lists for Alexander and his enemies including:


     Rise of Macedon - Army lists allowing you to recreate the Macedonian armies of Alexander and his father, Philip. 
     The End of Persia - Army lists allowing you to recreate the Persian army of Darius III and his Satrapal generals. 
     The Indian army - Army lists allowing you to recreate the Indian army of Porus as well as other Indian army variations. 
     Greek Mercenaries and Barbarian army lists from the period are also included, and these can fight either for, or against, Alexander. 


Accompanying each of the army lists are detailed notes on Warhammer Ancient Battles wargames tactics, and collecting & painting the armies of this defining period in history. Also included are a series of detailed Orders of Battle allowing you to follow in Philip’s and Alexander’s footsteps and recreate some of their famous encounters and campaigns:


     The Battle of Chaeronea 338 BC 
     The Battle of Granicus. 334 BC 
     The Battle of Gaugamela 331 BC 
     The Battle of Hydaspes. 326 BC 


Alexander the Great: Rise of Macedon 359 - 323 BC also contains a 16-page full-color section portraying the armies of the time and a wealth of illustrations and maps.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Armies of Chivalry
Description:
From the publisher:
Armies of Chivalry contains army lists for use with Warhammer Ancient Battles.

The lists will enable players to recreate battles for some of the greatest conflicts of the Age including The Hundred Years War, The War of the Roses, The Burgundian Wars, The Ottoman expansion, The Northern Crusades and The Wars in Eastern Europe.

The book includes special rules for recreating the character of warfare during the Medieval period when using the Warhammer Ancient Battles rules. There are also new rules and some updates and clarifications for the Warhammer Ancient Battles rule set.

There is a selection of rules clarifications and errata available online for Armies of Chivalry.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles
Families: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire

Name: Spartacus
Description:
From the publisher:
Spartacus' Slave Revolt was also known as the Great Slave War and this supplement focuses on the events surrounding that War as well as providing details of the two earlier revolts.

Featured within this 48-page book are army lists for the Slave and Roman armies, as well as a linear campaign for leading the slaves to freedom.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles

Name: Byzantium: Beyond the Golden Gate
Description:
Expands Warhammer Ancient Battles

From the publisher:
In the West, Rome may have fallen, but in the East, Byzantium ensured the Roman values and spirit endured for another 1000 years.

This 128-page sourcebook contains an historical overview of the period and covers events from 527 to 1204 A.D. During this period we see the rise of importance of the cavalryman on the field of battle and this book reflects that development as Byzantium repeatedly struggled and triumphed.

Featured within this book are detailed army lists including:


     Early Byzantines 527-660 AD - including the armies of Justinian and Heraclius. 
     Germanic Kingdoms 442-800 AD - including the armies of the Ostrogoths and Lombards. 
     Sassanid Persians 226-649 AD - including armies for the early and later Sassanid period. 
     Steppe Nomads 558-1200 AD - including the armies of the Magyars and Penchenegs. 
     Thematic Byzantines 660- 1042 AD - including the armies of the Isaurian and Macedonian dynasties. 
     Bulgars and Slavs 643- 1018 AD - including the armies of the early and later Bulgars. 
     Early Caliphates 632- 1073 AD - including the armies of the Arab Conquest and Abbasids. 
     The Rus 750-1250 AD - including the armies of the Early Pagan and Great Rus. 
     Later Byzantines1042-1185 AD - including the armies of the Komnenian dynasty. 


Using these 9 lists and appendixes you can create over 35 different variations of armies from the Byzantine period. Also included are some Orders of Battle for some famous encounters from the period including:


     The Battle of Dara 530 AD. 
     The Battle of Yarmuk 636 AD. 
     The Battle of Dorostolon 971 AD. 
    The Battle of Manizkert 1071 AD. 


The book also contains a 16-page full-color section portraying the armies of the time and a wealth of illustrations and color maps.

Name: Hannibal and the Punic Wars
Description:
From the publisher:
Hannibal Barca was the most famous general of his age. At the Start of the 2nd Punic War, against all odds, he marched his army over two mountain ranges and took on the Roman Republic; the mightiest empire of the ancient world. He won famous victory after famous victory and campaigned in his enemies homeland for 15 years. Not for half a millennia would Rome be challenged by an external threat of the same magnitude.

This source book contains a complete historical overview of the period taking in the three wars that Rome fought with the North African City state of Carthage (264 BC to 148 BC) with a description of the forces involved.

Featured with in this book are detailed army lists for all the key protagonists:


     Punic Army (Wars 1-3) 
     Republican Roman Army 
     Spanish 
     Numidians 
     Early Gauls 
     Ligurians 


Also included are maps and diagrams of key engagements such as Cannae, Lake Trasimene, and Zama the last battle of the 2nd Punic war.

The 112-page sourcebook also contains pages of color photographs depicting the armies of this period.

Expands

    Warhammer Ancient Battles

Name: The Art of War
Description:
Expands Warhammer Ancient Battles

From the publisher:
The Art of War: The Chinese approach to warfare 2205 BCE – 280 CE is a source book for Warhammer Ancient Battles.

China has the longest continuous civilization in history and was finally unified by the First Emperor in 221 BCE. The Warring States period was over, and Qin victorious! Yet only 16 years later, the Qin Dynasty was in turmoil, the Emperor dead and all that would remain of his legacy would be the silent warriors of Xian- the Terracotta army.

This source book contains an historical overview that covers the principle military events and developments of Chinese culture from small bands of tribal warriors right up to the mighty Imperial armies that dominated Asia.

Featured within this book are detailed army lists including:


     Shang Dynasty 
     Zhou Dynasty 
     Warring States 
     Eastern Steppe Nomads 
     Han Dynasty 
     Red Eyebrow Rebels 
     Yellow Scarves Religious Cultists 
     Three Kingdoms 


Using these army lists and variants within them you can create over 34 different varieties of armies from early Chinese history!

Other resources included are scenarios, battles, a campaign system and Ruses for use in your games, as well as advice for modelling Chinese armies and terrain in full colour.

The Art of War also contains a full colour section portraying the armies of the time and a wealth of illustrations and maps.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles
Families: History: Warring States Period of China

Name: Book of the Astronomican
Description:
This 112-page book includes:

     43-page 3-part campaign by Rick Priestley
     Whitescar Space Marines Army List
     Hylgar's Hellraisers Imperial Army Army List
     Valerius Borodin Rogue Trader Army List
     Claw Nebula Pirates Army List
     Luggub's Drop Legion Ork Army List
     Eldar Pirates Army List
     Some new Imperial Characters


Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader

Name: Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing: Colors
Description: This is an educational game that uses sets of cards to provide eight different card games for three learning levels aimed at teaching and reinforcing colors to children.

Name: Super Veo Veo
Description:
A boardgame version of "I Spy".  One player secretly selects a card which represents one of the characters pictured on the game board.

One by one the remaining players must try to guess the first player's secret character.  Players may only ask questions which may be answered "yes" or "no".  Each question or incorrect guess at the secret costs a player one of his ten chips.

The player who correctly guesses the secret identity collects the card from the first player.  The role of first player now passes to the next player to the left.

Once everyone has had a chance to be first player the game ends.  The game can also be played two or more rounds, depending on how long a game is desired.  The winner is the person who has the most cards.

Name: Magic Tent Game with Mystery Treasure Hunt
Description: It's a story, a game, and an adventure! Hank, Stella and Cody were camping one night in their grandfather's mysterious tent. When they woke up the next morning, they were in another part of the world! Can you solve the mystery of the Magic Tent and bring them home? Young adventurers climb into the full-size, indoor play tent and begin reading the story. The story contains hints to finding clues that parents have hidden around the house. The mystery and clues are provided in the Mystery Treasure Hunt, Vol. 1 Alaska, which is included with this set. After reading each hint, the kids climb out of the tent and race to find the hidden clue. When they have collected all the clues, they'll fit them together to reveal a secret message. It's an active and imaginative game for groups or individuals. The high-quality tent makes a colorful, sturdy play structure. It stands nearly 5 feet tall and 4 feet across, with stay-open tabs and mesh ventilation panels. Made from sturdy, flame-retardant, 70 denier nylon. Comes with 48" x 58" Nylon Tent, 15 Tent Poles, Mystery Treasure Hunt and Illustrated Instructions. For 1 or More Players, Ages 7 and up.

Name: The Magic Tent Expansion Pack: Mystery Treasure Hunt Vol. 2 – Australia
Description: Designed for use with The Magic Tent, this second volume brings a brand new story and an all-new adventure full of mystery and imagination. Hank, Stella, and Cody camped out one night in their grandfather's mysterious old tent. When they awoke the next morning, they were in another part of the world. It's up to you to solve the mystery and help bring them home again! This time the adventure takes place in Australia. As kids read the story inside their own Magic Tent (not included), parents will hide clues around the house. During key points in the story, the kids will read a hint, climb out of the tent, and race to find the hidden clues. When they do, they'll put them together to reveal a secret message that helps them to solve the mystery! It's an exciting activity for groups or individual kids. It combines reading, imagination, problem-solving, active play - and it's just plain fun! This kit comes with a 58 page adventure book, 7 secret clues, and a smart card with instructions and additional information for parents. For use with The Magic Tent - sold separately. 1 or More Players, Ages 7 and up.

Name: Crazy-Cups
Description:
The aim of Crazy Cups is to stack the Crazy Cups in stacks of varying heights and then take the stacks back down such that the cups are stacked neatly back into each other.

It is essentially a game of dexterity and you are aiming to beat either your best time to do a particular routine or the time that was set by the other people playing it with you.

Similar to:

    Kup Stax

Name: Fields of Honor
Description:
Fields of Honor - an Historical Simulation of Warfare in the 19th Century" is a  set of miniatures rules for recreating the wars from 1843 to 1902 in five different unit scales from section to brigade.

The 120-page book contains army lists and weapon data for 21 different wars, including the Crimean War, Mexican-American War, Americal Civil War, Franco-Prussian War, most British colonial wars and the Boxer Rebellion. Five scenarios are also included: Alma, Isandhlwana, Gravelotte-St. Privat, Khartoum and Little Big Horn.

The rules later inspired two sequels - FoH: the American War for Independence and FoH: WWII.

Name: Compatibility
Description: This is a party game intended for adult couples.  The object is for couples to score points by matching their answers to questions in six different categories (Sex, General issues, Entertainment, Children, Work , and Domestic Issues).  The winners are the first couple to accumulate at least 100 points, including at least 10 in each category.

Name: Jim Prentice Electric Basketball
Description: Jim Prentice Electric Basketball from 1949. Each player has three terminal buttons. Players each select one or two buttons to push during a play. The combination of both players choosing one or two buttons results in a play or a shot depending on where on the court the play started from.

Name: The Make My Day Card Game
Description: This is a card game with a political satire theme.  Players take the role of world leaders and compete for power by accumulating positive public relations (PR) points for themselves and damaging the PR scores of other players.  Game contents include rules, score pad, marking pen and 216 cards.

Name: Le Signal
Description:
Probably made during World War II since the cardboard is very flimsy, prints aren't centered and some cards have both straight angled and rounded corners.

This must be a Belgian version with text in both Flemish and
French languages. The spelling is quite old.

Goal of the game is to collect and play cards to drop a certain amount of bombs on the enemy. As an opponent cards can be played to harass and slow down the other player (pilot dead, bad weather,...)

Name: Taliesin Master Game
Description:
The advanced version of Taliesin Starter Game, Taliesin Master Game is played on 3 circular boards, one on top of the other.  There are nine different types of player piece, in gold or silver, each with unique movement.  The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Life Force piece.

The core of the 3 boards is a "black hole" and this is the means of transferring pieces between boards.

Name: Taliesin Starter Game
Description:
Taliesin (Starter Game) is played on a round board with 19 pieces on each side and is very similar to chess, with soldiers moving one space, centurions moving like rooks, Taliesin moving in all directions and capturing the opponent's Life Force being the object of the game.  There are nine different types of piece, but several move in the same way as others; White Goddess and Shogun are essentially the same pieces, as are King Arthur, Henge and Centurion.

There is also Taliesin Master Game, which has 3 boards with additional rules.

Name: Kies het Hazenpad
Description:
A basic roll & move trivia game about nature and the environment.
Players gain Families cards by answering right to the questions, they loose a card.
The game ends when a player has 5 of the 7 different Families cards.

Name: Ship Shape
Description: First player to fill all the shapes on their ship wins. The spinner indicates the piece (circle, triangle, or square) a player may place.

Name: Mondrian
Description:
From Games of Art, Mondrian is a game based on the artwork of Piet Mondrian known for his paintings of rectangles of color.

The object of the game is to complete rectangular areas with color, scoring points for the number of sections within the rectangle.  Players are prevented from coloring in adjacent sections with the same color.

Name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Benghazi Handicap
Description:
A campaign book for Command Decision: Test of Battle covering the Desert War from June 1940 to December 1941.

Features the following:
--Unit histories, TO&Es, and game stats for Italian, German and British forces.
--Special rules for the desert war.
--A dozen historical scenarios.
--Painting & Terrain building guides.

Expands:

    Command Decision: Test of Battle
Families: Series: Command Decision, Test of Battle

Name: The Spawn of Yog-Sothoth
Description:
From the instructions:
Player #1 represents the investigators who have witnessed strange murders on the Miskatonic University Campus and now seek to find and destroy the cause of these murders before greater evil befalls Arkham. The evil is the spawn in human form, Wilbur Whately [sic]. To win, the investigator player must find and destroy him before or after he transforms into the spawn.
Player #2 represents the spawn and the cultists that worship and protect him. This player must eliminate all professor, police, reporter, and detective counters from play. At any point that he achieves this goal, player #2 wins the game. In the process of this, player #2 attempts to have Wilbur kill enough people to gain the energy he needs to transform into the spawn. Once Wilbur is the spawn, it will be much easier for him to attack and win.
Wilbur must transform into the spawn by the end of the last full moon phase on the turn track or his opportunity will pass until next year. Should he fail to transform into the spawn by the end of this phase, the game ends in a stalemate.

Name: Thugs!
Description: A tile laying game where you are building a maze and trying to move your pawn to an exit while trapping everyone else. There are several types of tiles (e.g., thugs who you can fight to take cards from your opponents; medics who can heal you; mole people, who help move you around to different parts of the maze; etc.) that make up the maze. There is also an action deck that can move you or your opponents around the maze, or reconfigure the maze. The first person out of the maze wins!

Name: Jim Prentice Electric Fire Fighters
Description: Another Electric game from Jim Prentice. This one is called JIM PRENTICE Electric Fire Fighters. I have little information about the game except that by pushing a trigger device you respond to the call for help fighting a fire.

Name: Aeroplane Race: 'Round the World Fliers
Description: This is a fairly basic spin and move game where players compete to be the first to complete an airplane race around the world.  The large square metal board is a world map with a racing course plotted on it.  The board has 2 spinners on it, which players use to control their airplane movement.  Various other spaces/map coordinates have other bonus and hazard effects on the race.

Name: Mr. Surgeon
Description: This game is very similar to "Operation," in that it is a physical dexterity game where the players play the role of a surgeon operating on a cartoon-like character.  In this version, players use a fork like tool to carefully remove various pieces of the patient without causing him to shake and wake up.

Name: Franklin's Treasure Hunt Game
Description:
Franklin, Bear, Fox, and Snail are on their way home from school, and the teacher has given each an exciting challenge: Try to fill score cards with things they have found on the way home!

Players search for the treasure chips that match their score card. The winner is the player who is the first to find all the chips in his set. Versions are included for beginning and advanced players.  No reading required.

Franklin’s Treasure Hunt Game is intended to help players to develop skills of visual discrimination, sorting and classifying, as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing, and respecting others.

Name: Quarterback
Description: Billed as the "Computerized Action Game," Quarterback used a combination of offensive/defensive cards selected by the players combined with a small mechanical rolling piece to determine the outcome of football plays.  Licensed by the NFL Players association, Quarterback invited players to play against each other as one of 16 NFL quarterbacks of the period.

Name: Paartie
Description:
Paartie - Plauderspiel für Partner is a cardgame for adults. Players use cards to try and gain gems. You win gems by knowing what your partner thinks, feels, wants. A game for relationships.

Ages 18 and up. Released: Essen 2007.

Name: Ave Caesar: Kurs 1
Description:
UNRELEASED GAME

    
    
         Note that all details of this game are preliminary. This game has not been released, and since its announced release date has long since passed, this game might never be released. This listing serves as a historical record; you are invited to submit corrections or update this section if additional information comes to light.

    


Ave Caesar: Kurs 1 (Course 1) will include a double-sided board with two new tracks, six horsecarts, six coins and 144 cards. The art is by Eckhard Freytag and Ingrid Berner.

Expands:

    Ave Caesar

Name: The Game of Football
Description:
The Game of Football produced by Parker Brothers in 1880 features a picture of young boys playing a game that looks a bit like sandlot football. The game comes with a number of colored pieces that represent players and by jumping over players each team tries to score goals.

As a version of late-1800s football, this game would be completely different from the same-named Game of Football from 1948, as the rules of the physical game developed significantly in the intervening 70 years.

Name: Warhammer: Chariot Wars – A Supplement for Ancient Battles
Description:
From the publisher:
Seven detailed lists cover the greatest empires of the ancient Middle East - 2500 BC to 500 BC: the age of chariot warfare.

Each list covers one of the following great empires and nations, including allies and opponents, historical background information, and descriptions of troop types:


     Sumerian & Akkadian. 
     New Kingdom Egyptian. 
     Hammurabic Babylonia Empire. 
     Hittite Empire. 
     Mycenaean Greek and Trojan Armies. 
     The Israelites. 
     Assyrian Empire (including Babylonians). 


Chariot Wars is also a source book of historical information for each army list, including detailed time lines of historical wars and campaigns which make use of controversial new research. There are also notes on tactics, painting, military organization, and color plates.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: Warhammer: Armies of Antiquity – A Supplement for Ancient Battles
Description:
From the publisher:
Armies of Antiquity contains army lists for use with the Warhammer Ancient Battles rules. The lists cover all of the most famous armies of the ancient world, from the chariot armies of ancient Egypt through to armies of crusading knights.

New rules to use in your Warhammer Ancient Battles games. 
22 new army lists, including:
Sumerian, Egyptian, Hittite, Trojan Wars, Assyrian, Persian, Ancient Greek, Alexander & His Successors, Ancient Indian, Republican Roman, Carthaginian, Late Roman, Cataphract, Byzantine, The Nomad Hordes, The Saracens, Saxon, Viking, Norman, Crusader, Chinese, and Samurai.

Special tribal variations which can be used with the Barbarian army list included in Warhammer Ancient Battles.

Please note: Armies of Antiquity is now out of print, but many of the lists are available in the new edition (version 1.5) of the Warhammer Ancient Battles rulebook and more detailed lists in the many sourcebooks made available since this book's release.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles

Name: Legends of the Old West: The Alamo – Victory or Death
Description:
From the publisher:
This lavish book deals with one of the most infamous battles in the Old West when the Mexican army fought Texans at the Alamo mission in San Antonio. Inside you¹ll find new rules, army lists and scenarios so you can take your battles to a whole new scale, creating sweeping military actions to recreate the Texas War for Independence.

Relive the battle of the Alamo. Change history at San Jacinto. Hire David Crockett, James Bowie, or even Generalissimo Santa Anna to join your cause.

The fate of a nation rests in your hands.

Expands:

    Legends of the Old West


Expanded by:

    Legends of the Old West: Showdown which includes rules errata

Name: Quasselstrippe
Description:
The title translates as tattletale or motormouth.  A trivia party game for 2-8 people, it may have been first published February 1994 Spiel im Heft Spielzeit (Playtime Magazine).  See designer's website http://www.burkhardt-spiele.de/Quasselstrippe.htm for a copy to print and play (in German).  You will want to use die of different colors.  It looks as though you roll the dice and have to name a plant, a politician, whatever to move forward and the name has to begin with the letter on the trail from start to finish.
Ages 8 and up

Name: Warhammer 40,000 Compendium
Description:
This 200-page book is a "best of" White Dwarf.

From the publisher:
This book is a collection of the best of White Dwarf Warhammer 40,000 articles.  It provides you with a complete update on the forces and technologies of the Warhammer Universe.  The Warhammer 40,000 Compendium contains the complete army lists for: Space Marines, Imperial Guard, Squats, and Harlequins together with their histories and backgrounds.  In addition, it includes the new rules for Dreadnoughts, Robots, and other fighting machines together with all of the revised rules for vehicles.

Expands:

     Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader

Name: Das Lieblingsspiel von Adam Riese
Description:
Das Lieblingsspiel Von Adam Riese (the Favorite Game of Adam Riese) is a simple self-published wooden abstract arithmetic game for two that plays in 5 to 10 minutes, and that comes in a pouch.

Each player (light and dark) plays on the same off-set grid of three rows up and three rows down. Each row has a start value of ten and four spaces to fill, except one space marked (+), resulting in fourteen spaces in all to fill. Each player has 10 stones to place: four square value stones (4, 3, 2, and 1), three round arithmetic symbol stones (the minus sign, the division sign, and the multiplication sign), and 3 tall round scoring markers (two in their own colour and one in their opponent's). Players take turns to place one stone of their own choice from their own supply onto the appropriate spaces. After all stones are placed, the scores are determined. Each player scores all the rows that are marked by the tall scoring stones of their color (one of which is placed by the opponent), and the score for each row is the outcome of the simple formula that players have created with the stones. Whoever gets the most points overall is the winner.

Adam Riese, in the title, refers to the great German mathematician Adam Ries, better known as Adam Riese (1492-1559), whose work contributed to the phasing out of the impractical Roman numerals in favour of the Arabic numerals that we currently use, and who made it his life's ambition to bring the basics of mathematics and algebra to all people. For that reason, he wrote his science books in German, rather than in Latin, the language of the scientific elite, and was one of the first to do so. The German phrase "nach Adam Riese" (according to Adam Riese) is still used as an expression in the German language to emphasize the obvious correctness of a result of simple arithmetic.

Name: One The Board Game
Description:
"An enlightening and non-competitive game for Christians from different backgrounds to explore and share their beliefs" (From box cover).

Players move their pieces, answer questions and vote on Christian discussion topics to gain game segments.  Game continues until all have 6 segments; there are no winners or losers.

Published on behalf of the Churches in Great Britain and Ireland.

Name: Du bist der Größte, kleiner Rabe
Description:
You are the Biggest, Little Raven! All the forest friends of little Raven race from all edges of the forest to little Raven's nest in the meadow.  Each team has three animals and little Raven is the judge. The first team member to reach the center gets a piece of the cake from little Raven in its nest.  Naturally he or she takes the largest piece.  And once the pieces are distributed, little Raven determines which crew won.
An exciting game for color learning.
Contents: game board, 12 play figures, 1 little Raven, 1 Raven nest, 8 pieces of cake of different sizes, 2 color cubes, and rules.
Ages 4 and up.

Name: Post Office
Description: The winner becomes the Postmaster by returning to the Post Office after delivering all their mail.  Plan mail routes which can be altered by draw cards.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Die Bombe tickt!
Description:
The Bomb is Ticking!: Your knowledge can save the city.
A self-published game created by Burkhardt and the senior class of Schubart-Realschule, Geislingen an der Steige, Germany.  It centers abound the city of Geislingen as threatened by a bomb.  Players need to know the answers to general and city-specific questions.  With each wrong answer a figure advances forward to detonate the bomb.  Conversely, if three questions are answered correctly, the players receive one of six puzzle pieces.  When completed, the pieces combine to make a pair of scissors that can cut the fuse in time and thus save all the players and their city.  This game may be the genesis of Burkhardt's DEUTSCHLAND - Finden Sie Minden (the map game for 3-5 players published by Kosmos).

Name: Stress am Strand
Description:
A game as varied as one day at the beach.  The sun shines, the sunscreen disappears, and the boombox blares.  Appears to be a companion game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the FRECHE MÄDCHEN FRECHE BÜCHER or IMPUDENT GIRLS IMPUDENT BOOKS.
Designer's site says it is for girls Ages 10 - 14.
http://www.burkhardt-spiele.de/Meine%20Ludographie.2.htm

Name: Catch the Hare
Description: The earliest recorded hunt game in Europe, Catch the Hare was mentioned in Libro de los Juegos (Book of Games) commissioned by Alfonso X in 1283.  It is played on an alquerque board, with one side taking the part of a hare and the other taking 12 hunters.  The hunters must trap the hare so that it cannot move; the hare must kill enough hunters to make their task impossible.
Families: Traditional Games: Alquerque / Fanorona (Indian War Games)

Name: Miss Popularity
Description: Billed as "The True American Teen Game" and "The Game That All Girls Love to Play," this was a game marketed for preteen and teenage girls.  The game is a competition between players to achieve the highest level of "popularity."  The game had an interesting mechanism for determining whether a girl scored popularity: a small, pink, plastic phone—the Automatic Answer-Phone*

Name: Stellaluna Memory Game
Description:
A children's memory game with a theme based on the children's picture book by Janelle Cannon. Stellaluna loves her baby bird friends, but hates those icky bugs they have to eat in Mother Bird's nest! She needs to find her own bat family again and feast on yummy mangoes. Help Stellaluna learn the skills she needs to be a bat again.

Players take turns turning over memory chips. If it is a helper chip, they place it the sky path and move Stellaluna one space forward. If it is not, they turn it back over again and leave it in place. When Stellaluna reaches home, all players win! There is a more advanced ruleset for older players.

This game is intended to teach young players to develop memory and story-telling skills as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing and respecting others.

Name: Tier-Express
Description: The zoo animals are jostling to get inside the holiday express. But not all the animals will fit! Already the first ones tumble off the wagon! Who with a bit of skill will get their animals inside the train? A pushing game for 2 to 4 skillful players.

Name: Die Wilden Hühner und die Liebe
Description: Game tie-in to the German 2007 film of the same name based on the book by the writer of "Inkheart", Cornelia Funke.  The title translates as "Wild Chickens and Love."  The description at Amazon.de makes it sound like a romantic polygon of Sprotte, Melanie, Frieda, Wilma, Trude, and Maik. The players try to collect the correct pairs.  Contents: 5 collecting maps, 35 cards, 4 three wooden meeples, and 49 wild chicken markers.  For Ages 8 - 13.

Name: Finger Dinger Man
Description: Players take turns being either Finger Dinger Man or Super Slow Man.Depending on the card drawn, Finger Dinger Man is released down a ramp towards Super Slow Man. Buttons are pushed to fake out your opponent by both players. The winner gets a card. Object:To win the most Finger Dinger Man cards.

Name: Lingo Word Dice
Description:
Not to be confused with the Lingo games which are played with pegs, cards or scrabble-like tiles.

The 25 letter dice are placed at random into the spaces of the grid. The 12 scoring pegs are placed in the holes in the corners.

Players then take turns to think of words beginning with the letters showing on the tops of the dice in the grid & each time a player names an acceptable word they remove the appropriate die from the grid & keep it (for scoring at the end of the game).

The winner is the player with the highest number of points !

Name: The Game of Categories, Answers and Fun
Description: The object of the game is to fill in the spaces of the game sheet with answers that start with a designated letter and are associated with a specific category within the allotted time. This is very much like the game Scattergories that came a year before it.

Name: Siege the Moment!
Description: A cardgame where players use collections of cards to attack and defend, themed around castle sieges.  The first player to successfully attack three times wins.  Designed for a 2002 competition to create a game based on siege attacks.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Montréal Métro
Description:
1962: The city of Montreal's population booms to over 1 million people, and the city stands on the verge of international recognition. By the conclusion of the next decade, Montreal will host both the World's Fair, and the Summer Olympics. In the present, Mayor Jean Drapeau recognizes the immediate need for mass transit, a subway system.

This Age of Steam expansion puts players in the role of government planners, building the Metro, and transporting passengers on the island of Montreal. Unique features present in this map include neutral track (Government Links) and a new split level Locomotive, to take advantage of that track. Montreal was designed with the explicit, and sole goal of supporting the 3 player scale, and has several changes to enhance the play for that number of players. It is intended for experienced Age of Steam players.

Name: The Transformers Card Game
Description:
The Transformers Card Game consists of four games using a 36-card deck containing 18 Autobots and 18 Decepticons. The following are the four games that can be played and a brief summaryof each:

1.)The Transformers Truth Game:  The object is to get rid of all your card by placing two, three or four cards on the table and declaring that they are all the same numbered card.  If any opponent thinks you are bluffing then  he declares this.  The player than shows the cards.  If the player lied than he takes all the cards.  However, if he was telling the truth then the opponent takes all the cards.

2.)Robot Battle: This game is played like the game "War" where you want to be the one with all the cards at the end.

3.)The Transformers Brainpower: This is a matching game where all cards are placed face down on the table and then two cards are flipped.  If they are the same, then the player takes the pair and goes again.  However, if the cards are different then the players turn is over. The player with the greatest number of pairs wins.

4.)The Transformers Shout: In this game, each player flips over cards one at a time.  When a card is duplicated, the first person to spot this and yell "transformers" gets all the cards on then table.  This continues until one player has no cards.  At that time, the player with the most cards is the winner.

Name: I.Q. Games: United States History
Description:
How well do you know your US History?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the place, event or person in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Name: I.Q. Games: Wild Animals
Description:
How well can you identify wild animals?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the animal in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Helmsman: The Game of Table Top Sailing
Description: Helmsman The Game of Table Top Sailing Made in England by Minimodels LTD. The object of this game is for two or more players to complete the sailing course on the board by fair sailing and superior skill thereby beating your opponents.

Name: Beat the Bookie
Description: Beat the Bookie published by Chad Valley/Barclay Toys from London in 1965. Game features a four foot long mechanical track, a game betting board and 5 metal "horses". Turning a crank on the game board moves the horses down the track and eventually  produces a winning horse.

Name: Football Widows Game
Description: This 1980 game from Real Life Games from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma is really just a football gambling game. You use real life football games and then bet on which team will win and cover the spread. You are playing with play money. The game tells you to add up your total wins and loses and then either laugh or cry. Game comes with a supply of play money and a weekly score sheet to mark down how you are doing.

Name: Rund um den Kalender
Description: A children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move around the board collecting cards representing the cycle of nature (the seasons).  In the process they learn the days of the week and months of the year.  A dexterity element occurs when one player must drop the four-seasons card and another player must quickly catch it.

Name: Mickey Mantle: Roger Maris Official Home Run Derby Game
Description: The baseball game is played by throwing Styrofoam balls at prongs contained within the target areas.  Object was to have balls stick to the board in the HOME RUN area. The game comes with 3 Styrofoam balls and a small instruction sheet.

Name: Ein Song für Tom
Description:
Appears to be a companion card game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the Sassy Girls, Sassy Books series.  http://www.frechemaedchen.de/
The “Song for Tom” is set in the world of showbiz and music competitions.  The players all have a crush on bitter-sweet Tom.  Each player tries to form "girl groups" to win the contest first with a foursome, then a trio, and finally as a duo of musician cards.  The first to complete a group receives a lucky stone as a reward. It takes three stones to win but heart-breaker Tom can appear at anytime to change the line-up.

Name: Official Mickey Mantle Baseball Action Game
Description: From Key Man; The box depicts a great picture of Mickey Mantle ready to swing the bat. The plastic toy is Approximately 7" long. Batter swings, and hits ball off standing tee when plunger is pushed.

Name: Win A Card
Description: Win-A-Card Board Game was put out by Milton Bradley in 1969 and came with 1968 Topps Baseball cards. Football and Non Sports cards were also included. The cards came in clear cellophane packs.  The game box reads "Contains a generous supply.", probably between 50-70 baseball cards, and various amount of the other sports, and non sports cards. The 1968 Topps cards that were included with the game are of a different variation to the regular issued Topps cards. The backs of the cards are a bright yellow color as opposed to orange backs. Game included a spinner which was used to determine if trades of cards between players took place.

Name: Zahlen-Zauber
Description: Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move their fantasy character (fairy, dwarf, giant or wizard) through the Charm Forest looking for treasures.  Each treasure is of a particular quantity (4 stars, 6 jewels, etc.).  The player must correctly reveal the right number treasure in order to advance towards the castle.  The first player to reach the castle wins.

Name: Ritter Kunibert im Zahlenland
Description: Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players must help the good knight Kunibert catch the evil Zahlenteufel ("number devil") by solving simple math problems.

Name: Süße Jungs & Abenteuer
Description:
Freche Mädchen - Süße Jungs & Abenteuer: another in the 
Freche Mädchen Freche Bücher or Sassy Girls, Sassy Books-related game series by Komos.  This one is story-telling teen party game about their first teacher or the first boy with whom they were in love. Afterwards the player investigates the cover stories of the others.

Name: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game
Description: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game. Another Electric Game from Jim Prentice. This time the push button electronic connections determine which cars move on their trip around the track trying to win the race.

Name: Rätsel in der Leseburg
Description: Children's game (Ages 6 - 9) in which players take turns using the catapult to shoot cardboard tokens ("rocks") into the castle.  If it lands in a section with a closed door, the player must correctly answer a "mystery" which tests their reading comprehension skills.  Answering correctly awards the player the treasure in that room.  The player with the most treasure wins.
